programme.title: Dr. Pimple Popper
programme.desc: Roger returns with his gigantic nose growths in the hopes that Dr. Lee and her colleagues can help before it's too late. Christine has lost her essence due to a large growth on her shoulder. Tiffany has a recurring cyst on her eyelid.

programme.title: My 600-lb Life
programme.desc: For James B, food means family. He grew up eating rich Haitian food and loves it with a passion. Now, James needs Dr. Now's help to diminish that love in order to survive, but a death in the family sends James retreating back to the comforts he knows.

programme.title: Too Large
programme.desc: After Dr. Procter postponed Corey's bariatric surgery and increased his weight loss target to 25 pounds, Corey tries to stay focused on his diet. A successful blind date provides a welcome boost of confidence before Corey's impending surgery approval.

programme.title: 1000-lb Sisters
programme.desc: Tammy must see a new therapist, but things don't go the way she'd hoped. Amy wants to lose her excess skin, but she gets bad news at the plastic surgeon's office. Chris faces the scale. If he's below 400 pounds, his surgery is on.

programme.title: Darcey & Stacey
programme.desc: Darcey and Stacey seek shelter from COVID-19 in apartments down the hall from each other. Relationships are put to the test when Darcey invites Georgi to quarantine with her and Stacey decides to secretly exchange wedding vows with Florian.

programme.title: Darcey & Stacey
programme.desc: After an eventful quarantine, Darcey and Stacey finally reunite for a couples' picnic. Stacey can't wait to share the news that she and Florian got married, but Darcey has news of her own that jolts Stacey out of her honeymoon phase.

programme.title: Invasion of the Christmas Lights 2
programme.desc: We criss-cross the U.S. and visit six homes where wizards of light out-do the neighbours and put on holiday displays that dazzle.

programme.title: My Big Fat American Gypsy Wedding
programme.desc: Gypsy Annie marries her first cousin in an outrageous fox fur wedding dress. Ana follows her heart but breaks the rules in the first gay gypsy wedding.

programme.title: My Big Fat American Gypsy Wedding
programme.desc: Outcast from their community, a family plans a christening with gypsy flare to reclaim their place in society. A gay gypsy couple breaks all the rules by getting married despite discrimination.

programme.title: My 600-lb Life
programme.desc: Chuck weighs almost 700 lbs. and it has hindered every aspect of his life. He's had to downsize his business, and his wife feels like a single parent who is ready to leave him.

programme.title: My 600-lb Life
programme.desc: Tanisha is desperate to survive for her kids and avoid her mother's tragic fate of dying at age 50 from super obesity. Megan and Ashley prepare for skin removal surgery.

programme.title: Too Large
programme.desc: George is a kind-hearted kindergarten teacher who weighs nearly 700 pounds. He is determined to lose weight to help him win back his ex-girlfriend. As George works hard to lose weight, he discovers that the love he has been missing most is self-love.

programme.title: Too Large
programme.desc: Jennifer used to do everything with her family, but a car accident five years ago led to severe weight gain and a massive lymphedema on her leg. Jennifer feels like bariatric surgery is her last chance to regain mobility and get her family life back.

programme.title: Too Large
programme.desc: Corey is a young gay man who is just getting back on his feet after being homeless. He has dreams of getting back into college and finding a serious relationship, but he needs to make huge changes if he is going to live his dreams - or live at all.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A boa constrictor has wrapped around a man's arm and won't let go; a young woman has a severe laceration but doctors begin to suspect there may be more to her case than the injury, a young man goes into anaphylactic shock after a dinner out.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A patient with a severe headache is seizing, then bruises erupt on her legs and her doctor has no idea why; a naked woman is behaving so oddly that her doctor thinks she's on drugs; and a wrestler has been vomiting for days, and the cause is a shock.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: An entire fraternity is plagued with blue urine; a pregnant woman may lose her baby to a tiny terror; and a man returns from a trip abroad with a souvenir that nearly costs him his life.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A man is impaled in his abdomen by a stiletto heel. A seemingly healthy outdoorsman has a series of seizures that baffle his doctors. Two patients make their doctor suspicious when they both complain about identical headaches that started during sex.

programme.title: My 600-lb Life
programme.desc: Ryan moved to Montana to keep himself from going down a dark path of drug addiction. However, his new path may be no less lethal than the last if he can't find a way to curb his eating habits before they kill him.

programme.title: Darcey & Stacey
programme.desc: Stacey and Florian head to Rhode Island for their mini-moon and invite Darcey and Georgi to join them. When Darcey questions Georgi about another woman, however, a dream vacation turns into a nightmare and a relationship is put in jeopardy.

programme.title: Hoarding: Buried Alive

programme.title: Hoarding: Buried Alive
programme.desc: Beverly's clutter fills every last square inch of her home. Upstairs, her three beloved dogs have made the space absolutely unlivable. With the threat of the city condemning her home, Beverly must clear the hoard or risk losing everything.

programme.title: Hoarding: Buried Alive
programme.sub-title: One Is Good, Two Is Better

programme.title: Cellblock 6: Female Lock Up
programme.desc: Nine women struggle to make sense of their time in jail and the actions that led to their incarceration. Four have just been arrested, three have been in and out of jail, one has been awaiting trial for five years and one is due to be released.

programme.title: Cellblock 6: Female Lock Up
programme.desc: A young mother faces the prospect of seeing her young son only through the visitation glass.

programme.title: Cellblock 6: Female Lock Up

programme.title: My Crazy Obsession

programme.sub-title: This Little Piggy and All Dolled Up

programme.title: My Crazy Obsession
programme.sub-title: Raggedy Ann and A Rat's Tale

programme.title: My Crazy Obsession
programme.sub-title: Star Chaser and the Little Merman

programme.title: My Crazy Obsession

programme.title: My Crazy Obsession

programme.desc: Officer Lopashanski makes a surprising discovery while searching an island for an injured bald eagle. Officers Cheney and Pushee stumble upon a trespasser whose vehicle is stuck in a mud hole. Officer MacFadzen leads the search for a missing swimmer.

programme.desc: Lt. Boudreau and Officer Hannett investigate a possible illegal turkey kill site, while Officer Bronson responds to a call about a snake in a bed. Officer Demler confronts a suspect about shooting a turkey on private property.

programme.desc: Officer Canfield meets a feisty swimmer looking for a fight. Anger reaches a boiling point when Officers Pushee and McKee ticket a dozen unruly ATV violators at once. And as Officer McKee monitors a sleeping bear, it becomes dangerously aggravated.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: Officer Holmes and trainee Frye respond to an ATV accident in which a man's head has been run over. Officer McKee helps relocate a rare rattlesnake. Officer Courtney assists a dog locked inside a car. On Mt. Willard, a collapsed student needs rescuing.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: Officers Lucas and Cyrs attempt a treacherous rescue on Mt. Washington, while Lt. Boudreau tracks down the owner of an abandoned vehicle. Officer Hannett and Trainee Crouse investigate a man shooting squirrels. Officer Fluette responds to a bear call.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: Officer Egan investigates the mysterious death of a deer. Officer Courtney and Lt. Cheney help a seal stuck in a tidal creek. Officer Bronson catches a young fisherman in a lie. And Officers lead the search for a woman with a head injury.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: Newly promoted Sgt. Lucas shows Trainee Frye the ropes during a busy ATV weekend. Hannett attempts to rescue an injured heron and later faces off with a moose. And lost hikers turn to Holmes for help as the sun goes down and temperatures drop.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: Officer Demler helps a hiker with a severe shoulder injury. Officer Fluette and K-9 Moxie take their certification test. Officer Holmes and trainee Frye look for evidence of an illegal deer kill. Officer MacFadzen bonds with his son on a hunting trip.

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People
programme.desc: The Wolfpack vows to make Christmas happier than ever for the newest generation, crafting unique homemade gifts for each other in a one-of-a-kind Secret Santa exchange. And the siblings surprise Mother Ami with a meaningful addition to the ranch.

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People
programme.desc: In the wilds of Alaska, Billy and Ami taught their seven children how to think outside the box to survive. As the family finds themselves at a crossroads after the passing of their patriarch, they celebrate the ways they use those lessons everyday.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch: Bloodline
programme.desc: Josh Harris gambles big on bringing the Cornelia Marie to Hawaii, hoping a trip to a legendary offshore fishing spot can save their season. But with a bigger boat comes bigger risks that threaten to shut down their entire business.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: Lieutenant Boudreau and trainee Crouse investigate a man who shot someone while hunting illegally. Sergeant Lucas responds to a porcupine wreaking havoc. Later, when a seriously ill hiker is trapped on Mount Garfield, Officer Holmes races to the scene.

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People
programme.desc: The Wolfpack vows to make Christmas happier than ever for the newest generation, crafting unique homemade gifts for each other in a one-of-a-kind Secret Santa exchange. And the siblings surprise Mother Ami with a meaningful addition to the ranch.

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People
programme.desc: In the wilds of Alaska, Billy and Ami taught their seven children how to think outside the box to survive. As the family finds themselves at a crossroads after the passing of their patriarch, they celebrate the ways they use those lessons everyday.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch: Bloodline
programme.desc: Josh Harris gambles big on bringing the Cornelia Marie to Hawaii, hoping a trip to a legendary offshore fishing spot can save their season. But with a bigger boat comes bigger risks that threaten to shut down their entire business.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: Officer Lucas sends a trainee to wrangle his first angry raccoon. Officer Fluette untangles a trapper's web of lies. Officer Benvenuti tries to rescue an injured gosling. Officers Boudreau and Hannett question father and son turkey hunters.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: Officer Joe Canfield investigates a home with multiple bear feeding complaints and finds more than he bargained for. Officer Egan investigates an abandoned car and missing persons case. And Officers respond to a drowning in the Connecticut River.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: Officer James Benvenuti chases down two lobster poachers in Rye. In a puzzling case, Officer Graham Courtney investigates a man on the beach found covered in blood. And Sergeant Adam Cheney attempts to apprehend trespassers on the railroad tracks.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: Up north, Sgt. Lucas checks duck hunters. Down south, Officer Benvenuti and Trainee Crouse question a man suspected of hunting over bait. Later, Sgt. Lucas and Officer Holmes attempt to free a cub stuck inside a trap before its mother returns.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: Officer Egan sets up a decoy and checks hunters at a popular bird hunting site. Officers Towne and Bronson help rescue an injured hiker on Mount Kearsarge. Plus, Lt. Boudreau and Officer MacFadzen investigate a hunting on private property call.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: Officer Canfield responds to a call about an orphaned bear cub. Sgt. Lucas pays an unexpected visit to a hunter suspected of illegal baiting. And Officer Cyrs investigates a large buck shot by a young, nervous hunter during muzzleloader season.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: Pre-dawn on opening day of rifle season, Lt. Boudreau and Officer Hannett pursue a night hunter. While up north, Officers Canfield and St. Pierre battle the snow to work a deer decoy. And in the city, Officer Frye wrestles an aggressive wild turkey.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: Officer Fluette and Moxie attend their graduation. Officer Holmes and trainee McDermott investigate a possible illegal bait site and run a decoy operation with Officer Egan. Sergeant Lucas checks on a moose with odd behavior.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: Officer Bronson questions a hunter who shot a deer without the proper permit, while Officer Demler runs radar on a popular snowmobile trail. Sgt. Lucas investigates a suspicious deer kill site. And Officer Cyrs responds to a snowmobile accident.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: Officer Hannett patrols for ice fishermen while Lt. Boudreau investigates a hunter who shot towards a road. Officer Holmes deals with a raccoon hiding in a warm chimney. And later, Officer St. Pierre goes on his first dive recovery under the ice.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: During a busy winter weekend, Lt. Boudreau encounters kite skiers, an illegal fire sled and a vandalized bob-house. Officer Canfield searches for a deer with an arrow in its head. Then, Officers Demler and Towne head our on a mountain rescue.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: Officers Bronson and Towne get more than they bargained for with a speeding snowmobiler. The K-9 unit performs winter training. Officer MacFadzen patrols an ice drag racing event. Then, Officer Cyrs heads into the woods to investigate a hit and run.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: At the state's largest ice fishing derby, Officer Canfield looks for the owner of a frozen fishing line while Major Juneau takes command of a mountain rescue. Officer McKee runs radar for snowmobiles. And Officer Cyrs checks on a moose in a bog.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: The dive team assists at an event in Hampton Beach, while Officer Courtney patrols the area's clam flats. Officers Hannett and Holmes patrol snowmobile activity across the state. And Officer Demler helps a bobcat that's been injured by a porcupine.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: Officer Crouse responds to a call about a nuisance raccoon, while Officer Towne searches for a deer attacked by coyotes. Officer Hannett monitors a suspicious fisherman and Officer St. Pierre responds to a call about an impaired driver.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: Lt. Boudreau teams up with trainee Masucci to track down a turkey hunter who may have shot from the road. When an animal release goes south, Officer Hannett lends a hand. Then, Officer Canfield races to catch a trespassing dirt biker.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: Nature lovers show up for Discover Wild New Hampshire Day. Officers conduct an undercover surveillance. Officer McKee rescues a starving owl from the side of the road. Later on, Mount Monadnock, a perilous rescue of an injured hiker.

programme.title: Gold Rush: The Dirt
programme.desc: Mine Rescue mavericks Freddy Dodge and Juan Ibarra invite The Dirt to Freddy's sprawling Colorado retreat. Freddy reveals his hometown operations, shows off a few prized possessions and hosts a Cajun boil where he meets baby Freddy for the first time.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: Officers St. Pierre, Benvenuti and K9 Cora investigate a couple accused of road hunting. An actress tries to perform her way out of a ticket with Officer Hannett. Officer Holmes gets an injured goose call and Officer Frye handles a neighbor dispute.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: The wardens, the National Guard, and dozens of volunteers team up in a massive, days-long search for a hiker missing in the vast wilderness of the White Mountains. And, the wardens take on some familiar faces in a charity softball game.

programme.title: Gold Rush: The Dirt
programme.desc: Mine Rescue mavericks Freddy Dodge and Juan Ibarra invite The Dirt to Freddy's sprawling Colorado retreat. Freddy reveals his hometown operations, shows off a few prized possessions and hosts a Cajun boil where he meets baby Freddy for the first time.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: Officer Fluette and Moxie attend their graduation. Officer Holmes and trainee McDermott investigate a possible illegal bait site and run a decoy operation with Officer Egan. Sergeant Lucas checks on a moose with odd behavior.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: Officer Hannett patrols for ice fishermen while Lt. Boudreau investigates a hunter who shot towards a road. Officer Holmes deals with a raccoon hiding in a warm chimney. And later, Officer St. Pierre goes on his first dive recovery under the ice.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: Officer Cyrs gets a call about a rabid fox that attacked a homeowner. Officer Crouse tracks down a group of ATV riders. Lt. Murphy talks to a farmer about a nuisance bear. Officers Frye and Jones investigate a hunter that may have shot from the road.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: Conservation Officers statewide join forces with volunteers and the National Guard to launch an intensive search for a missing hiker. In Littleton, Officer McKee gets news of a bear who has infiltrated a home in search of food.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: Lt. Boudreau and Officer Hannett have an unusually busy day on ATV patrol. Officer McDermott investigates a man who illegally shot a rabbit in a residential area. Officers Holmes and Cyrs use ATVs to rescue an injured hiker on Mount Carter.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: Lt. Mike Eastman investigates a case of stolen lobster traps. A man on a dirt bike flees the scene after being stopped for speeding, and Officer Hannett sends an injured pigeon to a local wildlife rehabber.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: Sgt. Pushee leads a multi-agency rescue mission to find a missing kayaker. A specialist is called in to locate a pesky bear roaming a residential area, and a boy is caught riding without a helmet and operating his ATV illegally.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: With the help of local police, Lt. Boudreau and Officer Hannett remove campers found illegally occupying state property. An 8-year-old boy is found riding solo on an ATV, and Officer Crouse helps two raccoon cubs found on the road.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: Officer McDermott finds an abandoned truck, sparking a winding investigation. Officer Holmes and Sgt. Lucas rescue paddlers of a capsized canoe. Later, Holmes responds to a moose accident, while OFC. Frye consoles a bereft woman.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: During a busy "Old Home Day.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: Lt. Boudreau and Officer Hannett revisit their most memorable moments: pursuing out-of-control dirt bikers, questioning dishonest hunters, investigating illegal pet alligators, chasing down burglary suspects, and more.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: In this special episode of North Woods Law, Sergeant Glen Lucas walks through some of his most memorable cases while also providing insight into what was happening behind the scenes. Cases include his car accident, memorable hunting cases, and more.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: This special episode highlights the New Hampshire Conservation Officer's most exciting interactions with the state's wildlife, including encounters with bears, moose, hawks, fawns, skunks and the endangered timber rattlesnake.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: On Mt. Monadnock, a severed finger is found, sending a team and K-9 Wyatt to search for other possible body parts. A family of repeat offenders are found riding their ATVs without proper protective gear, and a man admits to an illegal bear kill.

programme.title: NASA's Unexplained Files
programme.desc: When astronomers discover a rogue black hole speeding through the Milky Way, they investigate how much danger this cosmic monster poses to Earth, and what would happen if it ever entered our solar system.

programme.desc: When a former Area 51 insider alleges that the Roswell UFO incident was a nefarious Soviet conspiracy masterminded by Stalin, experts investigate if it was indeed an enemy plot against America, or whether the confession is just another cover-up.

programme.title: NASA's Unexplained Files
programme.desc: When NASA discovers something strange on Saturn's biggest moon, experts investigate if aliens feeding on the world's electric atmosphere could be the culprit. The disturbing evidence points to a grisly apocalypse if these monsters ever make it to Earth.

programme.title: How the Universe Works
programme.desc: Galaxies are locked in continual combat across the universe, and our own Milky Way will face its biggest opponent ever, the Andromeda Galaxy, in a titanic and deadly struggle that could create a new and unrecognizable super galaxy.

programme.title: How the Universe Works
programme.desc: The Rosetta mission was a ground-breaking expedition to land on a comet. Learn what the journey discovered and how these objects helped create life on Earth.

programme.title: How the Universe Works
programme.sub-title: Birth of the Monster Black Holes
programme.desc: New discoveries reveal an astonishing supermassive black hole that was born during the earliest days of the cosmos, and finding out how this giant grew so large so quickly may help to explain the very formation of the universe itself.

programme.title: How the Universe Works
programme.desc: A brand-new NASA mission to the Sun reveals cutting-edge discoveries about Earth's star. As the Parker Solar Probe dives through the Sun's atmosphere, what it finds challenges everything we know about this strange place.

programme.title: Mighty Planes
programme.desc: This modified Boeing 707 is one of only two 707 tankers in the world that provide commercial air-to-air refuelling to the American military. Omega Aerial Refuelling Services was launched in the late 1980s and these tankers are constantly in demand.

programme.title: Mighty Planes
programme.desc: Slicing through the eye wall of a hurricane, pounded by howling winds, blinded by rain and hail, NOAA's hurricane hunting WP-3D Orion aircraft flies where other planes refuse to venture. Witness the action as Hurricane Leslie threatens Bermuda and Canada.

programme.title: Mighty Planes
programme.desc: Travel with Donald Trump aboard his luxurious Boeing 757 on a transatlantic mission to the U.K. for a speech and pit stop at his new golf course in Scotland. Fog, runway curfews and security sweeps are just a few of the challenges faced by Captain Dunkin.

programme.title: Mighty Planes
programme.desc: The C-17 Globemaster III is the newest, most flexible cargo aircraft to enter the United States airlift force. The C-17 Globemaster specializes in quick delivery of troops and all types of cargo and can land and take off on short, rough runways.

programme.title: Mighty Planes
programme.desc: In 2010, the largest airborne observatory in the world opened its infrared eye for the first time from aboard a modified Boeing 747 jumbo jetliner. SOFIA boasts a 17-ton telescope capable of making observations impossible for ground-based telescopes.

programme.title: Mighty Planes
programme.desc: Go behind the scenes as the Blue Angels perform the last two shows of their season. Follow this group of Top Guns through the unique, specialized training and delve into the physics of their spectacular aerobatic flying.

programme.title: Mighty Planes
programme.desc: This modified Boeing 707 is one of only two 707 tankers in the world that provide commercial air-to-air refuelling to the American military. Omega Aerial Refuelling Services was launched in the late 1980s and these tankers are constantly in demand.

programme.title: Mighty Planes
programme.desc: Travel with Donald Trump aboard his luxurious Boeing 757 on a transatlantic mission to the U.K. for a speech and pit stop at his new golf course in Scotland. Fog, runway curfews and security sweeps are just a few of the challenges faced by Captain Dunkin.

programme.title: Mighty Planes
programme.desc: The C-17 Globemaster III is the newest, most flexible cargo aircraft to enter the United States airlift force. The C-17 Globemaster specializes in quick delivery of troops and all types of cargo and can land and take off on short, rough runways.

programme.title: Mighty Planes
programme.desc: In 2010, the largest airborne observatory in the world opened its infrared eye for the first time from aboard a modified Boeing 747 jumbo jetliner. SOFIA boasts a 17-ton telescope capable of making observations impossible for ground-based telescopes.

programme.title: Mighty Planes
programme.desc: Go behind the scenes as the Blue Angels perform the last two shows of their season. Follow this group of Top Guns through the unique, specialized training and delve into the physics of their spectacular aerobatic flying.

programme.title: Photos That Changed the World

programme.title: Photos That Changed the World
programme.sub-title: Hunting the President / The Hooded Man
programme.desc: As President Reagan waved, John Hinckley Jr. fired his gun, and photographer Ron Edmonds captured the vulnerability of political leaders. Also, The most memorable image from the war in Iraq.

programme.title: Photos That Changed the World
programme.sub-title: Munich Massacre / Mandela's Walk to Freedom
programme.desc: Kurt Strumpf's haunting photo of a balaclava-wearing terrorist at the 1972 Olympics; Greg English's photo of Nelson Mandela free for the first time in over a quarter of a century.

programme.title: Photos That Changed the World
programme.sub-title: The Terror of War / The Drowned Boy
programme.desc: The horrific photograph of 9-year-old Kim Phuc running from a napalm attack and the photograph of 2-year-old Alan Kurdi lying on a Turkish beach are featured in this episode.

programme.title: Arctic Vets
programme.desc: Dr. Chris helps a polar bear in Churchill, Manitoba, while an 800-pound muskox wakes up while having a hoof trim. A rescued polar bear struggles to walk.

programme.title: Arctic Vets
programme.sub-title: Mama Bear, Her Three Cubs, and a Movie Star Wolf
programme.desc: Dr. Stephen intervenes when an aggressive polar bear threatens a mama bear and her cubs. The vet team worries when a wolf that once worked in films is not eating.

programme.title: Arctic Vets
programme.sub-title: Beluga Scars, a Cracked Beak and Broken Polar Bear Teeth
programme.desc: An intern helps a peregrine falcon with an injured beak, then helps Dr. Chris with a half-ton bison. Dr. Stephen and C-Jae look at some scars on injured belugas, and Heather notices dental problems with a polar bear cub.

programme.title: Arctic Vets
programme.desc: Dr. Chris works with teh Polar Bear Alert Team to polar bears don't get too close to Churchill, MB. He also helps an injured bear at the Canadian Polar Bear Habitat in Cochrane, ON. A rescued lynx at Assiniboine Park Conservancy has a mysterious lump.

programme.title: Arctic Vets
programme.desc: An arctic fox needs a cyst removed from his eye. Heather and Jackie analyze polar bear poop to help conservationist C-Jae with a research project. Dr. Chris assists in the rescue of a great horned owl at Wild Life Haven Rehabilitation Centre.

programme.title: Arctic Vets
programme.desc: Two rescued grey wolves have tumours removed. Nine rescued polar bears receive check-ups, and a reindeer with dangerous antlers gets hoof trim.

programme.title: Arctic Vets
programme.desc: Dr. Chris helps a bald eagle that may have been electrocuted. Jackie and Heather honour a polar bear who passed away. A harbour seal has surgery eye surgery.

programme.title: Arctic Vets
programme.desc: Dr. Chris and teh team remove a mass from a wolf's mammary gland. An Arctic fox needs emergency X-rays.

programme.title: Arctic Vets
programme.desc: A trumpeter swan has a bumblefoot infection, and three baby burrowing owls are rescued.

programme.title: Arctic Vets
programme.desc: A young polar bear must get neutered, and Jackie says goodbye to the seals, polar bears and Heather as he leaves to work in a different part of Assiniboine Park Conservancy.

programme.title: Still Standing
programme.desc: New Brunswick’s Campobello Island is Canadian more by chance than by geography. The only year round and direct access to the mainland is a bridge to the US, which makes for a unique Canadian/American cultural blend and many challenges.

programme.title: Still Standing
programme.desc: Jonny is in Schreiber in Northern Ontario, where immigrants from Siderno, Italy left for a better life. While the mines, mills and railways have declined, the Mom-and-Pop shots, strong family ties, and unique heritage keep this struggling community alive.

programme.title: Still Standing
programme.desc: Jonny visits Harrison Hot Springs, BC, a town doubling down on creating a year round economy outside the resort, and hopes their other claim to fame, the elusive Sasquatch, will be the ticket.

programme.title: Still Standing
programme.desc: Jonny is in East Preston, NS, one of Canada's oldest indigenous black communities with a history that begins more than a hundred years before Canada itself.

programme.title: Still Standing
programme.desc: In May 2017, the Polar Bear Capital of the World unexpectedly became a fly-in community. A year of skyrocketing costs and unemployment are taking their toll but the community continues to hang on by its Northern grit, ingenuity and community spirit.

programme.title: Still Standing
programme.desc: If all goes well, Canadians will soon be able to drive from Fortune, NL to a little-known corner of France. With that will come a boost in tourism and employment opportunities, a welcome change from a decade of decline.

programme.title: Still Standing
programme.desc: Nipigon took a beating after its plywood mill burnt down. Today, the former mill town says it has 'a natural edge' and its the trumpeting the world-class hiking, climbing and fishing it has to offer.

programme.title: Still Standing
programme.desc: Once the homeport of pirates, and the launch pad of Amelia Earhart, Harbour Grace, NL, is a shadow of what it once was. The town is littered with crumbling monuments to its past greatness.

programme.title: Still Standing
programme.desc: Gravelbourg is facing an economic battle that’s led to outmigration, and a decline in French culture. In recent years, many different nationalities have settled in the town. This growing international population is helping maintain the local economy.

programme.title: Still Standing
programme.desc: Changing tastes and a shifting economy brought by the disappearance of its industries have left the once vacation destination of Bristol, Quebec looking to get its mojo back. Now a new group of entrepreneurs is trying to make Bristol a destination again.

programme.title: Still Standing
programme.desc: After losing its major lumber mills, Lumby lost not only hundreds of jobs, but also its sense of identity. Now the town is emerging, hopeful with a diverse economy that includes arts, culture and a 40-acre grow-op that’s hoping to make pot for pets.

programme.title: Still Standing
programme.desc: Every year, lots of people come to Calabogie for the ski slopes, raceway, winding roads and golf courses, but those who call Calabogie home year-round have gone without a backbone industry since its days as a resource town in the '60s.

programme.title: Still Standing
programme.desc: Over five years later, the Siksika Nation reserve is still dealing with the effects of a flood, but they hope the end is near. Now they use creativity, guidance from their knowledge keeper and plain old guts to build a future of good news.

programme.title: The Queen's Message and A Very Royal Wedding
programme.desc: Look back on the 1947 wedding between Queen Elizabeth II and Prince Phillip using real footage and home movies.

programme.title: The Coronation
programme.desc: For the 65th anniversary of Her Majesty the Queen's Coronation, The Queen shares memories of the ceremony as well as that of her father, King George VI, in 1937.

programme.title: Harry and William: What Went Wrong?
programme.desc: Explores the real cause behind Harry and Meghan's exit from the Royal Family, and how a rift between two brothers played a key part in their departure.

programme.title: Charles and Di: The Truth Behind Their Wedding
programme.desc: A look at the seven days leading up to the wedding of Prince Charles and Lady Diana Spencer.

programme.title: Charles: 50 Years A Prince
programme.desc: Prince Charles is now the longest-serving Prince of Wales in history and his affection for the nation and its people is as strong as ever.

programme.title: In Their Own Words - Princess Diana

programme.title: Secrets of the Royals: Inside the Crown

programme.title: Secrets of the Royals: Inside the Crown
programme.desc: A look at the Royal Family's relationship with the press, from censorship to the tabloid feeding frenzy.

programme.title: Secrets of the Royals: Inside the Crown

programme.title: Secrets of the Royals: Inside the Crown
programme.desc: A look at what it takes to be a monarch.

programme.title: The Coronation

programme.title: Street Outlaws
programme.desc: Chief introduces an idea to make the list even faster: The Shark Pool. Now, a hungry group of street racers will be showing up every week to take on #10. Doc and Monza battle. Farmtruck schools a shark pool racer regarding an old debt.

programme.title: Street Outlaws
programme.desc: With the popularity of the Shark Pool, Chief must host two race nights. Henson, Your Mom and Chuck 55 all show up to challenge the gatekeeper, leaving Shane swimming for his survival. On the second race night, Chief and Shawn rematch for the top spot.

programme.title: Street Outlaws
programme.desc: Daddy Dave returns as part of the Shark Pool with Henson's corvette 'Plan B,' along with new mother Tina Pierce and Boosted GT, after being dropped from the list. Farmtruck and AZN get a 'ricer,' and the rivalry between Jackie and Shane burns hot.

programme.title: Street Outlaws
programme.desc: Farmtruck and AZN build a bowling ball canon and get destructive. Chief races Brian 'Chucky' Davis, leading to the most devastating crash in SO history. Street racing will never be the same after this two-hour special.

programme.title: Street Outlaws
programme.desc: The dust has settled after the epic matchup between MSO and NOLA. But with the race still fresh on his mind, JJ gathers some of the fastest teams in America to discuss performance, strategy and if there will be another Fastest in America battle.

programme.title: Street Outlaws
programme.desc: Chief decides to get a new car, while the battle for top-list spots gets cutthroat. Meanwhile, Doc takes another shot against Shawn, Monza faces Reaper, Dave needs to get past Shane and a new shark must face the Farmtruck to get on the list.

programme.title: Street Outlaws
programme.desc: Big Chief is ready to make his No Prep debut as the racers roll into St. Louis for the third race of the season. NOLA is determined to deliver back-to-back upsets after the last race but the OKC and Texas aren't going down without a fight.

programme.title: Street Outlaws
programme.desc: With the Crow-mod almost ready, Chief confronts his PTSD to get back behind the wheel. Shawn faces Monza in his new Camaro, Boosted returns, Reaper takes another shot at Dave, but tensions between him and Dave's crew make race night a debacle.

programme.title: Street Outlaws
programme.desc: In the two-hour season finale, all bets are off for the final race. Chief faces post-crash PTSD as the Crow Mod and Farmtruck go for #10. Rookie Jeremy challenges Dominator to get #6. Reaper and Shane compete for spot #5. Shawn takes another shot at #1.

programme.title: Street Outlaws
programme.desc: The 405 crew is going Enduro racing and everyone is designing unique, one of a kind rides! The race quickly turns into a demolition derby. We also get to watch some never before seen races, brilliant pranks, wildest Chuck fights, and hilarious outtakes.

programme.title: Street Outlaws
programme.sub-title: Where the Streets Have No Name
programme.desc: 'Street Outlaws' returns and the list is shaken when Daddy Dave pulls Henson's Plan B from the one spot and starts from 10 in his own car. Farmtruck and AZN face off, Doc and Shawn prep to race for No.1 and Chief gets ready for his long march up the list.

programme.title: Street Outlaws
programme.desc: Since everyone in the 405 has been upgrading their cars, it's time to go under their hoods to find out what makes these guys so fast. Farmtruck and AZN struggle to fix the Dung Beetle for fishing, and set up races to get out of paying for some tuning.

programme.title: Street Outlaws
programme.desc: With faster cars than ever before trapped at the bottom, strategy and game playing take over list racing in the 405. Farmtruck and AZN salvage some explosive air bags. And on race night, it takes smart moves and a fast car to move up the new list.

programme.title: Street Outlaws
programme.desc: When the 405 gets a last minute call-out from Ohio, it's a rush to get ready. Farmtruck and AZN fish out a Hot Rod, and Kamikaze gets ready to bring the El Camino back. When Ohio arrives, the 405 tries to prove again they are the fastest on the street.

programme.title: Street Outlaws
programme.sub-title: I Still Haven't Found What I'm Looking For
programme.desc: It's time to shake things up for the 405 racers list. Shane finds himself a grudge race, but it turns disastrous after the finish line. Farmtruck and AZN get called out, and race night turns hostile when Dave and Reaper can't agree on a call out.

programme.title: Street Outlaws
programme.desc: With Dave in the top 5, and Chief close behind at 6, the pressure is on the top racers to be ready for a show down. Chief and Boosted setup an emergency turbo school for a struggling Dominator, and Farmtruck and AZN find themselves a flashy, orange fish.

programme.title: Street Outlaws
programme.desc: The OKC crew heads south to race at the Texas Motorplex in the American Outlaws Live event; more organized than the sport has ever been, this event may be the precursor to a national league of street racers.

programme.title: Street Outlaws
programme.desc: Frustration mounts on the 405 list. Racers try to hang on instead of move up. Farmtruck and AZN improve the Farmtruck, and test it out in a fishing race. On race night, things heat up when Dave makes a callout for a race he has no intention of racing.

programme.title: Street Outlaws
programme.desc: It's the last list race of the season, and that means the pressure is on for everyone to make their final moves towards the top. Kamikaze and Farmtruck both make their triumphant returns to list racing, and there will be a new number one on the 405 list.

programme.title: Street Outlaws
programme.desc: When JJ 'Da Boss' from Memphis invites the 405 to race, they leave their pro-mods at home and head east to the craziest race ever. Chuck is ready to prove himself, and the Memphis guys give the OKC racers a run for their money.

programme.title: Street Outlaws
programme.desc: Chief decides to put on a first-of-its-kind team race-off. Detroit, New York and California each bring a team to compete against OKC. Five of the 405's most OG racers step up to prove again that OKC has the fastest group of street racers in the country.

programme.title: Street Outlaws
programme.desc: The new season of Street Outlaws is about to begin and the 405 is moving away from Pro-mods on the street, so Chief and Shawn take a look back at how far the 405 has come since before the show. Then, we show some deleted scenes from the big Mega Race.

programme.title: Street Outlaws
programme.desc: Street Outlaws is back, and the guys in the 405 are making big changes. Chief decides to kick all the Pro-mods off the list. Then, it's time for an old school shakeup, everyone loses their spots and has to race to find out where they belong on the list.

programme.title: Street Outlaws
programme.desc: After the list shakeup, the 405 has an entirely new list, but everyone is still fighting to get to the top. With Dave down for repairs, Chuck, Ryan, Shawn and Monza battle to try to take the top spot, while Doc tries to get himself out of the bottom five.

programme.title: Street Outlaws
programme.desc: This week's race is all about the very top of the list and the very bottom. Ryan and Chuck are getting ready to battle for #1 again. At the bottom of the list, Farmtruck is feeling the heat and he does everything he can to hold onto a spot on the list.

programme.title: Street Outlaws
programme.desc: With Chief ready to take his new car up the list one more time, Reaper struggles to get his car fixed in time for race night. Meanwhile, Farmtruck and AZN think outside the box to round up some races, now that the truck is off the list.

programme.title: Street Outlaws
programme.desc: When JJ and his racers from Memphis come to OKC for two nights of racing, everyone in the 405 has to step up and get ready to lay it all on the line. But, after flagging and technicalities cause drama, the 405 has to fight for every win.

programme.title: Street Outlaws
programme.desc: Now that Chief is back on the list, he and Shawn map out a plan to get themselves back into the top spots. Farmtruck sets AZN up with a race against a doctor with a super car, and at race night, Doc seems like he finally has his car figured out.

programme.title: Street Outlaws
programme.desc: With only a few list races left, everyone gets serious about moving up the list. AZN gets a new tune for the Dung Beetle and tests out the improvements. On race night, when Doc gets into trouble, Chief pounces on his chance to make big moves up the list.

programme.title: Street Outlaws
programme.desc: It's the last list race of the season, and everyone in the 405 is looking to make one more move towards the top. Then, on race night, some of the top guys don't bring their cars, and plans to move up the list blow up in Doc's and Chief's faces.

Meanwhile, a mysterious gunslinger with a score to settle (Charles Bronson) and McBain's new wife, Jill (Claudia Cardinale), arrive in town.

programme.desc: After a woman misses a routine bank run with her sister, panic begins to spread among her family members, then the family's worst fears are realized when a passerby finds the woman's frozen, nude body in an alley.

programme.desc: High school freshman Shaun Ouillette vanishes the day after a snowstorm; an anonymous letter leads detectives into the frozen woods, where they make a discovery that will tear the small town apart.

programme.title: Dead of Winter
programme.desc: A pastor finds bartender Robbie Schmidt strangled in the snow shortly before Christmas; Robbie's family is shocked when suspicion falls on his closest friend.

programme.title: Shampoo
programme.desc: Against the backdrop of Nixon's election to office, Beverly Hills hairdresser and notorious rake George Roundy (Warren Beatty) runs into trouble when his lascivious habits begin to clash with his more responsible business ambitions. Things get even more complex when Roundy asks his wealthy mistress, Felicia Karpf (Lee Grant), for a business loan, unaware that his best friend and ex-girlfriend, Jackie (Julie Christie), is sleeping with Karpf's husband, Lester (Jack Warden).

programme.title: The Cutting Edge
programme.desc: Stuck-up figure skating whiz Kate Moseley (Moira Kelly) is denied a gold medal at the 1988 Olympics after a fall. As Kate drives off partner after partner, her coach, Anton (Roy Dotrice), must quickly find her a new one in order to be ready for the next Olympics. Enter arrogant former Olympic hockey player Doug Dorsey (D.B. Sweeney), who briefly encountered Kate years before. Reluctantly teaming up, Kate and Doug's icy rapport begins to thaw, resulting in a chemistry both in and out of the rink.

programme.title: Unlocked
programme.desc: After failing to apprehend the terrorist behind a Paris attack that claimed dozens of lives, CIA agent Alice Racine is forced to live in London as a caseworker. Her mentor unexpectedly calls her back into action when the CIA discovers that another attack is imminent. Alice soon learns that the classified information she's uncovered has been compromised. Running for her life, she turns to a former soldier to help her prevent a lethal biological attack on the citizens of London.

programme.title: Anaconda
programme.desc: Filmmaker Terri Flores (Jennifer Lopez) is traveling deep in the Amazon jungle looking for a forgotten tribe. Terri and her crew, which includes an anthropologist (Eric Stoltz) and a cameraman (Ice Cube), come across Paul (Jon Voight), who is stranded on the riverbank. He offers to help them find the tribe, but his secretive behavior puts everyone on edge. They realize too late that he's using them to find a legendary anaconda that's worth a fortune -- if they can catch it.

programme.title: The Kill Team
programme.desc: When a young U.S. soldier in Afghanistan witnesses other recruits killing civilians under the direction of a sadistic sergeant, he begins to fear that the men he's serving with might be the ones to kill him.

programme.title: VICE
programme.sub-title: Take Down the CCP & World's Coolest Dictator
programme.desc: Isobel Yeung meets the ex-Chinese real estate tycoon Guo Wengui and explores his web of disinformation spreading throughout the U.S.; David Noriega travels to El Salvador to find the truth behind the supposed achievements of its millennial president (New!).

programme.title: The Last Black Man in San Francisco
programme.desc: Jimmie and his best friend Mont try to reclaim the house built by Jimmie's grandfather, launching them on a poignant odyssey that connects them to their past, even as it tests their friendship and sense of belonging in the place they call home.

programme.title: The Last Tree
programme.desc: After growing up in quiet, rural Lincolnshire, teenager Femi struggles with unfamiliar surroundings and cultural differences when he moves in with his mother in London.

programme.title: Boogie Nights
programme.desc: In the San Fernando Valley in 1977, teenage busboy Eddie Adams (Mark Wahlberg) gets discovered by porn director Jack Horner (Burt Reynolds), who transforms him into adult-film sensation Dirk Diggler. Brought into a supportive circle of friends, including fellow actors Amber Waves (Julianne Moore), Rollergirl (Heather Graham) and Reed Rothchild (John C. Reilly), Dirk fulfills all his ambitions, but a toxic combination of drugs and egotism threatens to take him back down.

programme.title: Dexter: New Blood
programme.desc: Dexter turns from predator to protector out of concern that a serial killer has set its sights on someone he cares deeply about; Angela arrests someone who may be the culprit of a cold case; Harrison turns to a dangerous person as a father figure.

programme.title: Yellowjackets
programme.desc: The Yellowjackets tangle with the birds and the bees, navigating love, lust and DIY surgery; in the present: blackmail, bunnies and an icy reunion; Misty prepares for a surprise(d) houseguest.

programme.title: Fruitvale Station
programme.desc: Though he once spent time in San Quentin, 22-year-old black man Oscar Grant (Michael B. Jordan) is now trying hard to live a clean life and support his girlfriend (Melonie Diaz) and young daughter (Ariana Neal). Flashbacks reveal the last day in Oscar's life, in which he accompanied his family and friends to San Francisco to watch fireworks on New Year's Eve, and, on the way back home, became swept up in an altercation with police that ended in tragedy. Based on a true story.

programme.title: The Last Black Man in San Francisco
programme.desc: Jimmie and his best friend Mont try to reclaim the house built by Jimmie's grandfather, launching them on a poignant odyssey that connects them to their past, even as it tests their friendship and sense of belonging in the place they call home.

programme.title: The Flintstones in Viva Rock Vegas
programme.desc: Fred Flintstone, the boy from the wrong side of the rocks, courts the beautiful, young heiress Wilma Slaghoople. Along with best friend Barney Rubble, and his future fiancee Betty, Fred and Wilma head off for a romantic weekend in Rock Vegas, the hottest rock resort on the continent.

programme.title: The War With Grandpa
programme.desc: Peter and his grandpa used to be very close, but when Grandpa Jack moves in with the family, Peter is forced to give up his most prized possession: his bedroom. Peter will stop at nothing to get his room back, scheming with friends to devise a series of pranks to drive him out. However, grandpa doesn't give up easily, and it turns into an all-out war between the two.

programme.title: Aeon Flux
programme.desc: In the 25th century, the Earth's population has dwindled to a surviving five million following a devastating virus that almost resulted in the extinction of all human life 400 years earlier. Confined to one city-state, a group of rebels, led by Handler (Frances McDormand), seeks to destroy the oppressive government -- first, by assassinating a high-ranking chairman (Marton Csokas). Tasked with this mission, Aeon Flux (Charlize Theron) must integrate herself in a world of deceit and mystery.

programme.title: The Talented Mr. Ripley
programme.desc: To be young and carefree amid the blue waters and idyllic landscape of sun-drenched Italy in the late 1950s; that's la dolce vita Tom Ripley (Matt Damon) craves- and Dickie Greenleaf (Jude Law) leads. When Dickie's father asks Tom to bring his errant playboy son back home to America, Dickie and his beautiful expatriate girlfriend, Marge Sherwood (Gwyneth Paltrow), never suspect the dangerous extremes to which Ripley will go to make their lifestyle his own.

programme.title: National Lampoon's Animal House
programme.desc: When they arrive at college, socially inept freshmen Larry (Thomas Hulce) and Kent (Stephen Furst) attempt to pledge the snooty Omega Theta Pi House, but are summarily rejected. Lowering their standards, they try at the notoriously rowdy Delta Tau Chi House, and get in. The trouble is, the college dean (John Vernon) has it in for the Deltas. He has put them on "Double Secret Probation" and secretly assigned Omega's president (James Daughton) the task of having their charter revoked.

programme.title: The Real Charlie Chaplin
programme.desc: Combining unheard audio recordings, dramatic reconstructions and personal archives, filmmakers Peter Middleton and James Spinney trace Charlie Chaplin's meteoric rise from the slums of Victorian London to the heights of Hollywood superstardom.

programme.title: The Gentlemen
programme.desc: Mickey Pearson is an American expatriate who became rich by building a highly profitable marijuana empire in London. When word gets out that he's looking to cash out of the business, it soon triggers an array of plots and schemes -- including bribery and blackmail -- from shady characters who want to steal his domain.

programme.title: The Survivalist
programme.desc: A year and a half after the fall of civilization due to a viral outbreak, a former FBI agent is forced to protect a young woman immune to the disease from a dangerous gang leader hunting her.

programme.title: Fruitvale Station
programme.desc: Though he once spent time in San Quentin, 22-year-old black man Oscar Grant (Michael B. Jordan) is now trying hard to live a clean life and support his girlfriend (Melonie Diaz) and young daughter (Ariana Neal). Flashbacks reveal the last day in Oscar's life, in which he accompanied his family and friends to San Francisco to watch fireworks on New Year's Eve, and, on the way back home, became swept up in an altercation with police that ended in tragedy. Based on a true story.

programme.title: The Real Charlie Chaplin
programme.desc: Combining unheard audio recordings, dramatic reconstructions and personal archives, filmmakers Peter Middleton and James Spinney trace Charlie Chaplin's meteoric rise from the slums of Victorian London to the heights of Hollywood superstardom.

programme.title: Scarface
programme.desc: After getting a green card in exchange for assassinating a Cuban government official, Tony Montana (Al Pacino) stakes a claim on the drug trade in Miami. Viciously murdering anyone who stands in his way, Tony eventually becomes the biggest drug lord in the state, controlling nearly all the cocaine that comes through Miami. But increased pressure from the police, wars with Colombian drug cartels and his own drug-fueled paranoia serve to fuel the flames of his eventual downfall.

programme.title: The War With Grandpa
programme.desc: Peter and his grandpa used to be very close, but when Grandpa Jack moves in with the family, Peter is forced to give up his most prized possession: his bedroom. Peter will stop at nothing to get his room back, scheming with friends to devise a series of pranks to drive him out. However, grandpa doesn't give up easily, and it turns into an all-out war between the two.

programme.title: Apollo 13
programme.desc: This Hollywood drama is based on the events of the Apollo 13 lunar mission, astronauts Jim Lovell (Tom Hanks), Fred Haise (Bill Paxton) and Jack Swigert (Kevin Bacon) find everything going according to plan after leaving Earth's orbit. However, when an oxygen tank explodes, the scheduled moon landing is called off. Subsequent tensions within the crew and numerous technical problems threaten both the astronauts' survival and their safe return to Earth.

programme.title: The Humans
programme.desc: Erik Blake gathers three generations of his Pennsylvania family to celebrate Thanksgiving at his daughter's apartment in lower Manhattan. As darkness falls and eerie things go bump in the night, the group's deepest fears are laid bare.

programme.title: Dances With Wolves
programme.desc: A Civil War soldier develops a relationship with a band of Lakota Indians. Attracted by the simplicity of their lifestyle, he chooses to leave his former life behind to be with them. Having observed him, they give the name Dances With Wolves. Soon he is a welcomed member of the tribe and falls in love with a white woman who has been raised in the tribe. Tragedy results when Union soldiers arrive with designs on the land.

programme.title: Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World
programme.desc: In 1805, aboard the H.M.S. Surprise, the brash Captain Jack Aubrey (Russell Crowe) and his trusted friend, the ship's scholarly surgeon, Stephen Maturin (Paul Bettany), are ordered to hunt down and capture a powerful French vessel off the South American coast. Though Napoleon is winning the war and the men and their crew face an onslaught of obstacles, including their own internal battles, "Lucky Jack" is determined that nothing will stop the Surprise from completing its mission.

programme.title: Apollo 13
programme.desc: This Hollywood drama is based on the events of the Apollo 13 lunar mission, astronauts Jim Lovell (Tom Hanks), Fred Haise (Bill Paxton) and Jack Swigert (Kevin Bacon) find everything going according to plan after leaving Earth's orbit. However, when an oxygen tank explodes, the scheduled moon landing is called off. Subsequent tensions within the crew and numerous technical problems threaten both the astronauts' survival and their safe return to Earth.

programme.title: The Humans
programme.desc: Erik Blake gathers three generations of his Pennsylvania family to celebrate Thanksgiving at his daughter's apartment in lower Manhattan. As darkness falls and eerie things go bump in the night, the group's deepest fears are laid bare.

programme.title: Lee Daniels' The Butler
programme.desc: After leaving the South as a young man and finding employment at an elite hotel in Washington, D.C., Cecil Gaines (Forest Whitaker) gets the opportunity of a lifetime when he is hired as a butler at the White House. Over the course of three decades, Cecil has a front-row seat to history and the inner workings of the Oval Office. However, his commitment to his "First Family" leads to tension at home, alienating his wife (Oprah Winfrey) and causing conflict with his anti-establishment son.

programme.title: U-571
programme.desc: When a German U-571 submarine with a sophisticated encryption machine onboard is sunk during a World War II battle at sea, the Allies send an American Navy force led by Lieutenant Andrew Tyler (Matthew McConaughey) to retrieve it for study. Boarding the German ship, the Americans' cover as a rescue force is quickly blown. Forced to take the crew hostage, the Americans lay their explosives and prepare to destroy the German vessel before the Nazis can send naval backup.

programme.title: The Kremlin Letter
programme.desc: When an unauthorized letter is sent to Moscow alleging the U.S. government's willingness to help Russia attack China, former naval officer Charles Rone (Patrick O'Neal) and his team are sent to retrieve it. They go undercover, successfully reaching out to Erika Kosnov (Bibi Andersson), the wife of a former agent, now married to the head of Russia's secret police (Max von Sydow). Their plans are interrupted, however, when their Moscow hideout is raided by a cunning politician (Orson Welles).

programme.title: The Salzburg Connection
programme.desc: A U.S. lawyer (Barry Newman) joins Austrian intrigue over an old box containing names of Nazi collaborators.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible -- Ghost Protocol
programme.desc: Blamed for a terrorist attack on the Kremlin, Ethan Hunt (Tom Cruise) and the entire IMF agency are disavowed by the U.S. government, while the president initiates the Ghost Protocol. Forced to go "off the grid" -- left without resources or backup -- Hunt must somehow clear the agency's name and prevent another attack. Complicating matters even more, Ethan must undertake the impossible mission with a group of fellow IMF fugitives whose actual motives are suspect.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible Rogue Nation
programme.desc: With the IMF now disbanded and Ethan Hunt (Tom Cruise) out in the cold, a new threat -- called the Syndicate -- soon emerges. The Syndicate is a network of highly skilled operatives who are dedicated to establishing a new world order via an escalating series of terrorist attacks. Faced with what may be the most impossible mission yet, Ethan gathers his team and joins forces with Ilsa Faust (Rebecca Ferguson), a disavowed British agent who may or may not be a member of this deadly rogue nation.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible -- Fallout
programme.desc: Ethan Hunt and the IMF team join forces with CIA assassin August Walker to prevent a disaster of epic proportions. Arms dealer John Lark and a group of terrorists known as the Apostles plan to use three plutonium cores for a simultaneous nuclear attack on the Vatican, Jerusalem and Mecca, Saudi Arabia. When the weapons go missing, Ethan and his crew find themselves in a desperate race against time to prevent them from falling into the wrong hands.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible -- Fallout
programme.desc: Ethan Hunt and the IMF team join forces with CIA assassin August Walker to prevent a disaster of epic proportions. Arms dealer John Lark and a group of terrorists known as the Apostles plan to use three plutonium cores for a simultaneous nuclear attack on the Vatican, Jerusalem and Mecca, Saudi Arabia. When the weapons go missing, Ethan and his crew find themselves in a desperate race against time to prevent them from falling into the wrong hands.

programme.title: Krampus
programme.desc: While the holiday season represents the most magical time of year, ancient European folklore warns of Krampus, a horned beast who punishes naughty children at Christmastime. When dysfunctional family squabbling causes young Max (Emjay Anthony) to lose his festive spirit, it unleashes the wrath of the fearsome demon. As Krampus lays siege to the Engel home, mom (Toni Collette), pop (Adam Scott), sister (Stefania LaVie Owen) and brother must band together to save one another from a monstrous fate.

programme.title: The Quiller Memorandum
programme.desc: After two British Secret Intelligence Service agents are murdered at the hands of a cryptic neo-Nazi group known as Phoenix, the suave agent Quiller (George Segal) is sent to Berlin to investigate. There, he begins an affair with Inge Lindt (Senta Berger), a beautiful young teacher. However, their lives are put in danger after Quiller is kidnapped and taken to Phoenix's headquarters, where he meets Oktober (Max von Sydow), the mysterious leader of the group.

programme.title: Those Magnificent Men in Their Flying Machines
programme.desc: In 1910, newspaper mogul Lord Rawnsley (Robert Morley) decides to offer a large cash sum to the first pilot to successfully fly over the English Channel. Aviation experts from near and far enter the race, including the underhanded Sir Percy Ware-Armitage (Terry-Thomas), wild American flyer Orvil Newton (Stuart Whitman) and British ace Richard Mays (James Fox). Orvil and Richard come out as the front-runners, but both men are distracted by Rawnsley's lovely daughter, Patricia (Sarah Miles).

programme.title: Snow White and the Three Stooges
programme.desc: In a distant kingdom a great king has died, leaving his daughter, Snow White (Carol Heiss), vulnerable to the whims of his successor, the Evil Queen (Patricia Medina). To secure her crown, the queen orders her squire to murder the young princess. But the evil scheme fails, and Snow White escapes into the forest. There she encounters a cottage occupied by three lunkheaded puppeteers (The Three Stooges) and their charge, Quatro (Edson Stroll), a young man hiding his true identity.

programme.title: Daddy Long Legs
programme.desc: In this musical, American millionaire Jervis Pendleton (Fred Astaire) becomes taken with an orphan named Julie (Leslie Caron) while vacationing in France. Determined to improve the quality of Julie's life, he secretly sends money so she can receive a good education. After receiving a flurry of letters thanking her mysterious caretaker, Jervis decides to visit his pet project. When he arrives and sees that Julie has grown up into a beautiful young woman, he quickly falls for her.

programme.title: Carousel
programme.desc: Based on the lauded Rodgers and Hammerstein stage musical, this film follows the romance of Billy Bigelow (Gordon MacRae), a charming carousel barker, and Julie Jordan (Shirley Jones), a pretty worker from a nearby mill. When the attractive young couple gets married, they also both find themselves unemployed, which puts a strain on their relationship. When Billy finds out that Julie is pregnant, he resorts to extreme measures to get money, a decision that leads to tragedy.

programme.title: A Christmas Carol
programme.desc: Crotchety Victorian businessman Ebenezer Scrooge (Alastair Sim) has no use for festivity, even at Christmas. After resentfully allowing timid clerk Bob Cratchit (Mervyn Johns) to have the holiday to spend with his loving wife (Hermione Baddeley) and family, Scrooge is swept into a nightmare. The ghost of his late partner, Jacob Marley (Michael Hordern), appears, warning that Ebenezer will be visited by three more spirits who will show the coldhearted man the error of his parsimonious behavior.

programme.title: FX's A Christmas Carol
programme.desc: Ebenezer Scrooge experiences a dark night of the soul in an original take on Charles Dickens' iconic ghost story.

programme.title: A Christmas Carol

programme.title: FX's A Christmas Carol
programme.desc: Ebenezer Scrooge experiences a dark night of the soul in an original take on Charles Dickens' iconic ghost story.

programme.title: Stomp the Yard
programme.desc: After his brother's death, a troubled but gifted street dancer enrolls in Atlanta's Truth University. As he tries to concentrate on his studies and woo a pretty classmate, he finds himself in the middle of a tug-of-war between fraternities, who want to utilize his talents in an upcoming dance competition.

programme.title: Stomp the Yard: Homecoming
programme.desc: A troubled youth (Collins Pennie) must put his problems aside to lead a dance troupe in a national competition.

programme.title: The Devil Has a Name
programme.desc: An ambitious oil executive leaves the whole industry exposed when she tries to outwit a recently widowed farmer whose land has been poisoned.

programme.title: State of Play
programme.desc: Congressman Stephen Collins (Ben Affleck) is a rising star in Washington; handsome, unflappable and seemingly honorable, he's seen as his party's next presidential nominee. Until, however, his research assistant/mistress is found murdered and damaging secrets come pouring out. Journalist Cal McAffrey (Russell Crowe), Collins' old friend, must investigate the murder, and walks headlong into a massive cover-up involving some of the nation's most promising political and corporate figures.

programme.title: This Is the Year
programme.desc: In a last-ditch effort to win over the girl of his dreams, a nerdy high school senior and his best friends embark on a road trip to see their favorite band at the biggest music festival of the year.

programme.title: Filly Brown
programme.desc: Majo Tonorio (Gina Rodriguez), a talented hip-hop artist, is offered a record deal from a sleazy producer. She faces a difficult choice between selling out for money or staying true to herself and her music.

programme.title: Stomp the Yard
programme.desc: After his brother's death, a troubled but gifted street dancer enrolls in Atlanta's Truth University. As he tries to concentrate on his studies and woo a pretty classmate, he finds himself in the middle of a tug-of-war between fraternities, who want to utilize his talents in an upcoming dance competition.

programme.title: Last Man Standing: Suge Knight and the Murders of Biggie & Tupac
programme.desc: Filmmaker Nick Broomfield examines the unsolved murders of hip-hop artists Biggie Smalls and Tupac Shakur.

programme.title: The Craft: Legacy
programme.desc: An eclectic foursome of aspiring teenage witches get more than they bargained for as they lean into their newfound powers.

programme.title: Accepted
programme.desc: After receiving his latest college rejection letter, senior Bartleby Gaines devises a novel way to fool everyone into thinking he is college-bound: Open his own university. Bartleby and his similarly stymied friends take over an abandoned building, create a fake Web site, hire a friend's uncle to pose as the dean, and -- presto -- a school is born. However, they do their jobs too well, and soon many other rejects try to gain admittance to the nonexistent South Harmon Institute of Technology.

programme.title: The Dilemma
programme.desc: Longtime friends Ronny (Vince Vaughn) and Nick (Kevin James) are partners in an auto-design firm. They are hard at work on a presentation for a dream project that would really launch their company. Then Ronny spots Nick's wife out with another man, and in the process of investigating the possible affair, he learns that Nick has a few secrets of his own. As the presentation nears, Ronny agonizes over what might happen if the truth gets out.

programme.title: Buttons: A Christmas Tale
programme.desc: Two orphan girls have only one wish: to find a home for Christmas. With a little help from their guardian angels, they discover that miracles really can happen when you find the power to believe.

programme.title: Picture Perfect
programme.desc: Career-driven single woman Kate Mosley (Jennifer Aniston) is trying to get ahead in her advertising job and discovers that her boss is more inclined to promote married people. When her friend Darcy (Illeana Douglas) suggests that she use a photo of an acquaintance as proof of a fake fiancé, the deception seems to work, and Kate gets promoted. However, when her boss wants to meet Kate's husband-to-be, she has to track down the guy, Nick (Jay Mohr), and talk him into playing along with the ruse.

programme.title: The Craft: Legacy
programme.desc: An eclectic foursome of aspiring teenage witches get more than they bargained for as they lean into their newfound powers.

programme.title: Into the Blue
programme.desc: Divers Sam (Jessica Alba) and Jared (Paul Walker) love life in the Bahamas. But when friends Bryce (Scott Caan) and Amanda (Ashley Scott) visit, the couple take them on a treasure-hunting trip, where they discover more than they bargained for: a downed airplane full of cocaine alongside a famous shipwreck. Unknown to Sam and Jared, Bryce makes a fatal mistake and decides to sell the cocaine -- which angers a group of drug dealers, who are now in hot pursuit of the divers.

programme.title: The Stepford Wives
programme.desc: After enduring setbacks in her television career, executive Joanna Eberhart (Nicole Kidman) relocates with her family from New York City to the Connecticut suburb of Stepford. While Joanna's husband, Walter (Matthew Broderick), quickly warms up to their new town, she has a hard time adjusting to Stepford's manicured environs and the overly accommodating attitude of the area women. Soon Joanna begins to suspect that something is not right, and she tries to uncover Stepford's secret.

programme.title: The Craft
programme.desc: After transferring to a Los Angeles high school, Sarah (Robin Tunney) finds that her telekinetic gift appeals to a group of three wannabe witches, who happen to be seeking a fourth member for their rituals. Bonnie (Neve Campbell), Rochelle (Rachel True) and Nancy (Fairuza Balk), like Sarah herself, all have troubled backgrounds, which combined with their nascent powers lead to dangerous consequences. When a minor spell causes a fellow student to lose her hair, the girls grow power-mad.

programme.title: The Craft: Legacy
programme.desc: An eclectic foursome of aspiring teenage witches get more than they bargained for as they lean into their newfound powers.

programme.title: Liar Liar
programme.desc: Conniving attorney Fletcher Reede (Jim Carrey) is an ace in the courtroom, but his dishonesty and devotion to work ruin his relationships. His wife, Audrey (Maura Tierney), has left him for a more dependable man, and Fletcher often breaks the commitments he makes to his beloved son, Max (Justin Cooper). When Max wishes his dad would stop lying for 24 hours, Fletcher suddenly finds that he can only speak the truth -- on the day his career-deciding court case has to be won.

programme.title: Christmas With the Kranks
programme.desc: Finally alone for the holidays, Luther (Tim Allen) and Nora Krank (Jamie Lee Curtis) plan to eschew the Christmas traditions and take a cruise in the Caribbean instead. This doesn't sit well with their Christmas-obsessed neighbors Vic Frohmeyer (Dan Aykroyd) and Walt Scheel (M. Emmet Walsh), who are determined to win the annual "best decorated street" competition, and the Kranks soon find themselves social outcasts because of their lack of Christmas spirit.

programme.title: Cinderella
programme.desc: After her father unexpectedly dies, young Ella (Lily James) finds herself at the mercy of her cruel stepmother (Cate Blanchett) and stepsisters, who reduce her to scullery maid. Despite her circumstances, she refuses to despair. An invitation to a palace ball gives Ella hope that she might reunite with the dashing stranger (Richard Madden) she met in the woods, but her stepmother prevents her from going. Help arrives in the form of a kindly beggar woman who has a magic touch for ordinary things.

programme.title: Outlander
programme.desc: A Yule log burns on a hearth as part of a Christmas tradition (New!).

programme.title: Elf
programme.desc: Buddy (Will Ferrell) was accidentally transported to the North Pole as a toddler and raised to adulthood among Santa's elves. Unable to shake the feeling that he doesn't fit in, the adult Buddy travels to New York, in full elf uniform, in search of his real father. As it happens, this is Walter Hobbs (James Caan), a cynical businessman. After a DNA test proves this, Walter reluctantly attempts to start a relationship with the childlike Buddy with increasingly chaotic results.

programme.title: Elf
programme.desc: Buddy (Will Ferrell) was accidentally transported to the North Pole as a toddler and raised to adulthood among Santa's elves. Unable to shake the feeling that he doesn't fit in, the adult Buddy travels to New York, in full elf uniform, in search of his real father. As it happens, this is Walter Hobbs (James Caan), a cynical businessman. After a DNA test proves this, Walter reluctantly attempts to start a relationship with the childlike Buddy with increasingly chaotic results.

programme.title: Elf
programme.desc: Buddy (Will Ferrell) was accidentally transported to the North Pole as a toddler and raised to adulthood among Santa's elves. Unable to shake the feeling that he doesn't fit in, the adult Buddy travels to New York, in full elf uniform, in search of his real father. As it happens, this is Walter Hobbs (James Caan), a cynical businessman. After a DNA test proves this, Walter reluctantly attempts to start a relationship with the childlike Buddy with increasingly chaotic results.

programme.title: Grown Ups 2
programme.desc: Lenny Feder (Adam Sandler) moves his family back to his hometown to be with his friends, but he finds -- what with old bullies, new bullies, party crashers and more -- that he hasn't left the crazy life behind in Los Angeles. Lenny's friends must also cope with their own challenges: Eric (Kevin James) must face his ultimate fear; Kurt (Chris Rock) has gone back to work as a cable repairman; and Marcus (David Spade) learns that he has an 18-year-old son.

programme.title: Power Book II: Ghost
programme.desc: Tariq races against the clock for Yasmine; with pressure being placed on Monet, she struggles to wear the Tejada crown.

programme.title: Lake Placid
programme.desc: When a mysterious creature violently kills a man in a Maine lake, Jack Wells (Bill Pullman), the local game warden, looks into the bizarre case, along with Sheriff Hank Keough (Brendan Gleeson) and visiting paleontologist Kelly Scott (Bridget Fonda). Looking for clues in a tooth that the beast left behind, Kelly and the others eventually locate the monster, a massive and vicious reptile eager to devour anything in its path. Can the crocodile-like creature be stopped?

programme.title: Top Gun
programme.desc: The Top Gun Naval Fighter Weapons School is where the best of the best train to refine their elite flying skills. When hotshot fighter pilot Maverick (Tom Cruise) is sent to the school, his reckless attitude and cocky demeanor put him at odds with the other pilots, especially the cool and collected Iceman (Val Kilmer). But Maverick isn't only competing to be the top fighter pilot, he's also fighting for the attention of his beautiful flight instructor, Charlotte Blackwood (Kelly McGillis).

programme.title: Cinderella
programme.desc: After her father unexpectedly dies, young Ella (Lily James) finds herself at the mercy of her cruel stepmother (Cate Blanchett) and stepsisters, who reduce her to scullery maid. Despite her circumstances, she refuses to despair. An invitation to a palace ball gives Ella hope that she might reunite with the dashing stranger (Richard Madden) she met in the woods, but her stepmother prevents her from going. Help arrives in the form of a kindly beggar woman who has a magic touch for ordinary things.

programme.title: Christmas With the Kranks
programme.desc: Finally alone for the holidays, Luther (Tim Allen) and Nora Krank (Jamie Lee Curtis) plan to eschew the Christmas traditions and take a cruise in the Caribbean instead. This doesn't sit well with their Christmas-obsessed neighbors Vic Frohmeyer (Dan Aykroyd) and Walt Scheel (M. Emmet Walsh), who are determined to win the annual "best decorated street" competition, and the Kranks soon find themselves social outcasts because of their lack of Christmas spirit.

programme.title: Grown Ups 2
programme.desc: Lenny Feder (Adam Sandler) moves his family back to his hometown to be with his friends, but he finds -- what with old bullies, new bullies, party crashers and more -- that he hasn't left the crazy life behind in Los Angeles. Lenny's friends must also cope with their own challenges: Eric (Kevin James) must face his ultimate fear; Kurt (Chris Rock) has gone back to work as a cable repairman; and Marcus (David Spade) learns that he has an 18-year-old son.

programme.title: Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle
programme.desc: Four high school kids discover an old video game console and are drawn into the game's jungle setting, literally becoming the adult avatars they chose. What they discover is that you don't just play Jumanji - you must survive it. To beat the game and return to the real world, they'll have to go on the most dangerous adventure of their lives, discover what Alan Parrish left 20 years ago, and change the way they think about themselves - or they'll be stuck in the game forever.

programme.title: Top Gun
programme.desc: The Top Gun Naval Fighter Weapons School is where the best of the best train to refine their elite flying skills. When hotshot fighter pilot Maverick (Tom Cruise) is sent to the school, his reckless attitude and cocky demeanor put him at odds with the other pilots, especially the cool and collected Iceman (Val Kilmer). But Maverick isn't only competing to be the top fighter pilot, he's also fighting for the attention of his beautiful flight instructor, Charlotte Blackwood (Kelly McGillis).

programme.title: Power Book II: Ghost
programme.desc: Tariq races against the clock for Yasmine; with pressure being placed on Monet, she struggles to wear the Tejada crown.
