programme.title: Ghostbusters
programme.desc: After the members of a team of scientists (Harold Ramis, Dan Aykroyd, Bill Murray) lose their cushy positions at a university in New York City, they decide to become "ghostbusters" to wage a high-tech battle with the supernatural for money. programme.title: Ghostbusters II
programme.desc: After saving New York City from a ghost attack, the Ghostbusters -- a team of spirit exterminators -- is disbanded for demolishing parts of the city during the battle. But when Ghostbuster Peter Venkman (Bill Murray) learns that spirits have taken an interest in his son, the men launch a rogue ghost-chasing mission. The quest quickly goes awry, landing them in court. But when the ghosts turn on the judge, he issues an order allowing the Ghostbusters to get back to work.

programme.title: Gremlins
programme.desc: A gadget salesman is looking for a special gift for his son and finds one at a store in Chinatown. The shopkeeper is reluctant to sell him the "mogwai" but sells it to him with the warning to never expose him to bright light, water, or to feed him after midnight. All of this happens and the result is a gang of gremlins that decide to tear up the town on Christmas Eve.

programme.title: Scrooged
programme.desc: In this modern take on Charles Dickens' "A Christmas Carol," Frank Cross (Bill Murray) is a wildly successful television executive whose cold ambition and curmudgeonly nature has driven away the love of his life, Claire Phillips (Karen Allen). programme.title: Blink wire-free home security cameras help protect what matters

programme.title: Flip Wilson Show
programme.desc: Flip Wilson changed the face of TV comedy - he was charming, hilarious, and he looked great in a dress! The Flip Wilson Show debuted as the #1 variety show on TV and ran for four incredible seasons, winning multiple Emmys and a Golden Globe.

programme.title: Family Guy

programme.title: Family Guy

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter has to prove he has American Indian blood in him to win back Lois' gambling losses at a reservation casino.

programme.title: Family Guy

programme.title: Family Guy

programme.title: Family Guy

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Death asks Peter to fill in for him while he recovers from a sprained ankle at the Griffins' house. Voices of Seth MacFarlane, Alex Borstein, Seth Green and Mila Kunis.

programme.desc: Peter becomes mad with power during a production of ``The King and I,`` wrenching creative control away from Lois.

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: A gallery owner admires Chris' painting and invites the Griffins to New York; Peter envies an old classmate.

programme.desc: After Meg appears on a talk show, the network executives turn the Griffins' stupefying life into a reality series.

programme.title: Family Guy

programme.title: Arabian Inferno
programme.desc: The Arabian Peninsula is the world's transit hub for 3 billion birds that migrate to and from Europe, Africa, and Asia. Experience how the majestic raptors and magnificent waders fly, hunt, and survive in a region of extremes.

programme.title: Great Blue Wild
programme.desc: The coast of Mozambique is home to giants, like humpbacks and whale sharks, but the tiniest species play just as big of a role in the ecosystem. Meet the scientists who are working against the clock to protect coastal creatures big and small.

programme.title: Secrets Of Wild Australia
programme.desc: Australia is home to one of the most successful mammals on the planet: the bat. And one of the most gregarious of its kind is the flying fox. With its metre-long wingspan, the grey-headed flying fox is the largest fruit-eating bat in the country.

programme.title: America's Wild Seasons
programme.desc: It's spring: the season of courtship and new life. Witness nature awaken from its slumber in many forms, from the blossoms that explode in the rain-soaked desert of Arizona to the fuzzy wood ducklings that leap from their nests.

programme.title: America's Wild Seasons
programme.desc: Summer brings long, warm days for wildlife to thrive. Watch animals learn new skills, compete for mates, and escape predators as they try to make the most of the short season.

programme.title: Great Blue Wild
programme.desc: The coast of Mozambique is home to giants, like humpbacks and whale sharks, but the tiniest species play just as big of a role in the ecosystem. Meet the scientists who are working against the clock to protect coastal creatures big and small.

programme.title: Dogs With Extraordinary Jobs
programme.desc: A Labrador cross and its partner help prevent ecological disaster in Canada, a Lagotto Romagnolo unearths a rare delicacy in Washington forests, and a Belgian malinois team tracks down the critically endangered geometric tortoise to save the species.

programme.title: Guardians Of The Wild
programme.desc: Join an eventful journey that follows two orphaned elephants, Musolole and Zambezi, as they are moved from their nursery to Camp Phoenix, a release facility, where they learn to integrate with a new herd and begin their reintroduction to the wild.

programme.title: Africa's Wild Horizons
programme.desc: Travel to the rocky islands off of South Africa's coast, where thousands of creatures gather to breed. Huge colonies of gannets and hundreds of fur seals compete for space with rare African penguins. See organized chaos become the key to survival.

programme.title: City Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: A curious raccoon sticks his head a little too far into a peanut butter jar on a sweltering summer day in Toronto. See how the team gets him out of this sticky situation. Then cheer on a painted turtle who needs emergency eye surgery.

programme.title: City Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Follow the medical and rehab teams at Toronto Wildlife Centre as they work to clear a rescued fox of mange and return it to the wild. Elsewhere in the centre, meet scores of injured songbirds that have hit downtown buildings on their way south.

programme.title: America's Wild Seasons
programme.desc: It's spring: the season of courtship and new life. Witness nature awaken from its slumber in many forms, from the blossoms that explode in the rain-soaked desert of Arizona to the fuzzy wood ducklings that leap from their nests.

programme.title: Guardians Of The Wild

programme.title: Nature Scenes
programme.desc: One half hour of uninterrupted footage of two adorable twin baby tamarin monkeys sleeping, snuggling and watching the world around them with wide-eyed wonder. Animals in captivity filmed at Queensland Zoo.

programme.title: City Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Follow along as the wildlife rehab team works to treat a baby raccoon, separated from his family, and get him back in the wild before his parents move on. In another part of the centre, watch as an orphaned killdeer is introduced to...himself?

programme.title: City Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Join the rescue team as they respond to a call about an opossum stuck in a fence that turns out not to be the kind of animal that plays dead. Inside the centre, a goose with a serious foot injury receives physiotherapy before returning to the wild.

programme.title: Africa's Wild Horizons
programme.desc: Nature is under pressure and South Africa is paying the price. But with new investment in ecotourism, populations of animals are rebounding and many species are being reintroduced. Witness one of the most exciting conservation success stories in Africa.

programme.title: Wild Latin America
programme.desc: Follow the first months of a newborn humpback whale's life in the waters off the Pacific Coast of Columbia. See how his mother nurtures him through sickness, supports his body, protects him under attack, and prepares him for an epic journey.

programme.title: Great Blue Wild
programme.desc: The ocean covers 70 percent of our planet and is home to as many as one million species, but it's a group of microscopic organisms known as plankton that make the biggest impact. Learn how these tiny drifters help sustain all life on earth.

programme.title: Secrets Of Wild Australia
programme.desc: Marsupials have evolved in isolation to become some of the most extraordinary creatures on the planet. While they all share similarities, some of the rare smaller species like quokkas and quolls highlight their fascinating differences.

programme.title: Dogs With Extraordinary Jobs
programme.desc: A Labrador cross and its partner help prevent ecological disaster in Canada, a Lagotto Romagnolo unearths a rare delicacy in Washington forests, and a Belgian malinois team tracks down the critically endangered geometric tortoise to save the species.

programme.title: Dawn To Dusk
programme.desc: Follow penguins, iguanas, tortoises, frogs, and tamarins from Mexico to Peru and as far west as the Galapagos Islands as they live out their daily dramas, affected by the sun's heat, looming predators, and hazardous weather conditions.

programme.title: Dawn To Dusk
programme.desc: See how creatures from the Tibetan plateau, to the lush rainforests of Thailand, to Vietnam's twisted mangroves, survive four extra hours of daylight once a year, searching for food, fighting for dominance, and raising their families.

programme.desc: Follow penguins, iguanas, tortoises, frogs, and tamarins from Mexico to Peru and as far west as the Galapagos Islands as they live out their daily dramas, affected by the sun's heat, looming predators, and hazardous weather conditions.

programme.title: Dawn To Dusk
programme.desc: See how creatures from the Tibetan plateau, to the lush rainforests of Thailand, to Vietnam's twisted mangroves, survive four extra hours of daylight once a year, searching for food, fighting for dominance, and raising their families.

programme.title: Baby Animals
programme.desc: Not all baby animals are cute. Often, quirky physical traits are evolutionary adaptations that have helped a species survive. Visit four funny-looking youngsters, including a Baird tapir, two baby gelada baboons, an anteater, and a Bactrian camel.

programme.title: Great Parks of Africa
programme.desc: Covering 1,600 square kilometres in South Africa, Addo Elephant National Park is home to far more species than its namesake animal. Meet many of its fascinating residents, including white rhinos, great white sharks, and adorable African penguins.

programme.title: Great Parks of Africa
programme.desc: Harsh storms, wildfires, and heavy seas define Table Mountain National Park. Learn how its native animals and plants work together on the parched hillsides and windswept cliffs to form symbiotic partnerships that ensure mutual survival.

programme.title: Great Parks of Africa
programme.desc: Take a dip in iSimangaliso Wetland Park's unique mosaic of ecosystems. Explore grasslands, forests, swamps, lakes, beaches, and coral reefs, and see the incredibly diverse animal life its varied climatic zones support.

programme.title: Great Parks of Africa
programme.desc: Competition for resources is hot in the Great Karoo's semi-desert climate. Witness a young caracal, a small African cat, make his first kill after leaving his mother, and see how springboks, eagles, and zebras scratch out a living against all odds.

programme.title: Great Parks of Africa
programme.desc: Kgalagadi Transfrontier Park supports an array of species that have adapted creative survival strategies. Follow the park's ancient dry riverbeds and get a close-up look at how plants and animals tap into deep underground water sources to stay alive.

programme.title: Amazing Animal Friends
programme.desc: Meet six animal pairs who have developed unusual attachments. From a duck who overcame his fear of water thanks to a lake-loving dog to an orphaned deer who found friendship with a herd of cows, their bonds have surprising benefits.

programme.title: Amazing Animal Friends
programme.desc: When in need, animals sometimes turn to other species for companionship. See how a U.S. turkey who escaped dinner pairs up with a rescue dog, tiny U.K. songbirds raise a cuckoo chick, and a lonely meerkat in Namibia becomes part of a mongoose family.

programme.title: Amazing Animal Friends
programme.desc: The instinct to protect young ones is hard to suppress. Marvel at the way animals, both male and female, care for babies of other species. Meet a lonely rabbit who babysits lambs, and a little rescued rhino who finds encouragement from a playful dog.

programme.title: Amazing Animal Friends
programme.desc: Animals need companionship, just like humans, and these odd couples found it in species outside their own. Meet a miniature pig who befriends an outcast dog, and an orphaned baby kangaroo who shares a handmade pouch with a motherless little wombat.

programme.title: Amazing Animal Friends
programme.desc: Support animals for humans are common, but when they support other species, things get a little wild. Meet a troop of monkeys who invite three rescue cats into their home in a rescue centre, and a playful dog who cares for a rescued calf.

programme.title: Amazing Animal Friends
programme.desc: Rescue animals share a unique bond. Encounter these odd animal pals, including a bison who befriends a young calf, and an antelope who bonds with a young calf, as they team up to heal and sometimes return to the wild.

programme.title: Animal Empires
programme.desc: Raising the young is crucial for every species to survive. See how in some social circles, it takes a village to raise a family. In others, a single parent is all that stands between the vulnerability of youth and the threats of the wild.

programme.title: Amazing Animal Friends
programme.desc: Meet six animal pairs who have developed unusual attachments. From a duck who overcame his fear of water thanks to a lake-loving dog to an orphaned deer who found friendship with a herd of cows, their bonds have surprising benefits.

programme.title: Amazing Animal Friends
programme.desc: The instinct to protect young ones is hard to suppress. Marvel at the way animals, both male and female, care for babies of other species. Meet a lonely rabbit who babysits lambs, and a little rescued rhino who finds encouragement from a playful dog.

programme.title: A Bee's Diary
programme.desc: In a beehive, tens of thousands of tiny animals work toward a common goal: the survival of the colony. But what is life like for an individual honeybee? A Bee's Diary tells that story.

programme.title: Ocean Parks
programme.desc: Take a journey deep into the South Caribbean Sea to explore the protected waters of the Bonaire National Marine Park, home to thriving reefs, endangered sea turtles, sprawling mangroves, and a plethora of marine life.

programme.title: Ocean Parks
programme.desc: In the Florida Keys, mangrove swamps serve as nurseries for fish and hunting grounds for endangered waterfowl, seagrass serves as food and shelter for fish and crustaceans, and coral reefs host diverse fish species and endangered sea turtles.

programme.title: Ocean Parks
programme.desc: Journey to a vast underwater rainforest of kelp that's home to hundreds of species of fish, forming the largest marine sanctuary in the U.S. Nearly destroyed by overfishing and pollution, this spectacular ecosystem is once again teeming with life.

programme.title: Baby Animals
programme.desc: The sprawling primate family includes animals as different as monkeys, lemurs, and humans. Follow primate babies to see how they bond with their mothers, learn to socialize, and adapt to an ever-changing environment.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Witness veterinarian Dr. Amanda Salb save an elephant calf caught in a poacher's snare, racing time to treat the wound. Back at the base, an orphaned baby baboon meets his new family. A monitor lizard and duiker are returned to freedom in the wild.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Amanda puts a radio collar on one of the first cheetah cubs born in Malawi in twenty years and the team struggles to give a 4-meter python a physical. See a group of tourists deliver a rambunctious baby monkey they rescued from the pet trade.
